subject: Relationships
title: Community as Friendship Infrastructure
description: A short lesson to help you apply Community as Friendship Infrastructure.

hook.text: Japan builds community centers on every block. America builds parking lots. Guess which country is less lonely.

buildup.text: 'Third places' â€” cafes, parks, libraries â€” provide the repeated unplanned contact that friendship requires.

discovery.text: Communities with more third places have 40% higher rates of neighborly friendship and civic engagement.

twist.text: Suburban design eliminates third places. Car-dependent sprawl makes every social interaction require planning.

climax.text: Friendship isn't just a personal problem. It's an urban design problem. Architecture shapes our social lives.

punchline.text: Loneliness is partly an architecture problem. Third places are the cure.

quiz.question: What are 'third places' in community design?
options: Cafes, parks, and libraries that enable social contact
